member.name: T:PX.Data.Default`1
member.summary: Raises the FieldDefaulting event for the field to which the PXFormula attribute is attached once the specified field changes.
member.example:
The code below shows the usage of Default<> in the definition of a DAC field.
[PXFormula(typeof(Default<NotificationSource.setupID>))] public virtual string Format { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Default`2
member.summary: Raises the FieldDefaulting event for the field to which the PXFormula attribute is attached once the specified fields change.
member.example:
The code below shows the usage of Default<,> in the definition of a DAC field.
[PXDBCurrency(typeof(EPExpenseClaimDetails.claimCuryInfoID), typeof(EPExpenseClaimDetails.claimTranAmt))] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Employee Claim Amount")] [PXDefault(TypeCode.Decimal, "0.0")] [PXFormula(typeof(Default<curyTranAmt, curyTranAmt>))] [PXUIEnabled(typeof(Where<claimCuryInfoID, NotEqual<curyInfoID>>))] public virtual Decimal? ClaimCuryTranAmt { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Default`3
member.summary: Raises the FieldDefaulting event for the field to which the PXFormula attribute is attached once the specified fields change.

member.name: T:PX.Data.Default`4
member.summary: Raises the FieldDefaulting event for the field to which the PXFormula attribute is attached once the specified fields change.
member.example:
The code below shows the usage of Default<,,,> in the definition of a DAC field.
[PXDefault] [PXFormula(typeof(Default<inventoryID, contractID, taskID, customerLocationID>))] public virtual Int32? ExpenseSubID { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Parent`1
member.summary: Returns the value of the specified field from the parent data record. The parent data record is defined by the PXParet attribute.
member.typeparam: The field of the parent data record.

example.code: [PXUnboundFormula( typeof(Switch< Case<Where<SOLine.operation, Equal<Parent<SOOrder.defaultOperation>>, And<SOLine.lineType, NotEqual<SOLineType.miscCharge>>>, SOLine.orderQty>, decimal0>), typeof(SumCalc<SOOrder.orderQty>))] public virtual decimal? OrderQty { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Row`2
member.summary: Returns the value of the specified field and creates an additional dependency for the formula â€“ on the provided dependency field. Each time the dependency field is updated, the formula is recalculated. The formula also depends on all other field referenced in the formula.
member.typeparam: The field whose value is returned.

example.code: [PXFormula( typeof(Mult<Row<POLine.baseOrderQty, POLine.orderQty>, POLine.unitWeight>), typeof(SumCalc<POOrder.orderWeight>))] public virtual Decimal? ExtWeight { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Selector`2
member.summary: Searches for the PXSelector attribute on the key field and calculates the provided expression for the data record currently referenced by the attribute.
member.typeparam: The key field to which the PXSelector attribute should be attached.
The expression that is calculated for the data record currently referenced by PXSelector.

example.code: [PXFormula(typeof( Selector<APPaymentChargeTran.entryTypeID, Selector<CAEntryType.accountID, Account.accountCD>>))] public virtual int? AccountID { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Validate`2
member.summary: Raises the FieldVerifying event for the field to which the PXFormula attribute is attached once the specified fields change.

example.code: [PXFormula(typeof(Validate<ContractItem.maxQty, ContractItem.minQty>))] public decimal? DefaultQty { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Validate`1
member.summary: Raises the FieldVerifying event for the field to which the PXFormula attribute is attached once the specified field changes.
member.example:
The code below enables validation of the UnitRate field on changes of the INUnit.UnitMultDiv.
[PXDBDecimal(6)] [PXDefault(TypeCode.Decimal,"1.0")] [PXUIField(DisplayName="Conversion Factor", Visibility=PXUIVisibility.Visible)] [PXFormula(typeof(Validate<INUnit.unitMultDiv>))] public virtual Decimal? UnitRate { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Validate`3
member.summary: Raises the FieldVerifying event for the field to which the PXFormula attribute is attached once the specified fields change.

example.code: [PXFormula(Validate<MyDAC.field1, MyDAC.field2, MyDAC.field3>)] public virtual Decimal? ValidatedField { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Validate`4
member.summary: Raises the FieldVerifying event for the field to which the PXFormula attribute is attached once the specified fields change.

example.code: [PXFormula(Validate<MyDAC.field1, MyDAC.field2, MyDAC.field3, MyDAC.field4>)] public virtual Decimal? ValidatedField { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Add`2
member.summary: Returns the sum of Operand1 and Operand2.

member.name: T:PX.Data.BitwiseAnd`2
member.summary: Returns the binary AND of Operand1 and Operand2.

member.name: T:PX.Data.Case`2
member.summary: Specifies a condition to evaluate in the Switch clause and the expression to return if the condition is satisfied.
member.typeparam: The conditional expression, the Where class.
The value specified as field, constant, or function.
member.remarks: The condition is set by the Where clause. In the translation to SQL, Case is replaced with WHEN [conditions] THEN [expression].
member.example:
The code below shows the definition of a DAC field calculated at run time.
[PXDBInt] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Time")] [PXFormula(typeof( Switch< Case<Where<EPActivity.trackTime, NotEqual<True>>, int0>, EPActivity.timeSpent>))] public virtual Int32? TimeSpent { ... }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Case`3
member.summary: Specifies a single condition to evaluate in the Switch clause and the expression to return if the condition is satisfied, and allows attaching more Case clauses.
member.typeparam: The conditional expression, the Where class.
The value specified as field, constant, or function.
member.example:
The code below shows the usage of Switch and Case classes in OrderBy. Because of the expression with Switch, the rows with the FABookBalance.UpdateGL field equal to false will be placed before the rows with FABookBalance.UpdateGL equal to true.
[PXDefault(typeof( Search2<FinPeriod.finPeriodID, InnerJoin<FABookBalance, On<FABookBalance.deprFromPeriod, LessEqual<FinPeriod.finPeriodID>>>, Where<FABookBalance.assetID, Equal<Current<FixedAsset.assetID>>, And<FinPeriod.endDate, Greater<FinPeriod.startDate>>>, OrderBy<Asc<Switch<Case<Where<FABookBalance.updateGL, Equal<True>>, int1>, int0>, Desc<FinPeriod.finPeriodID>>>>))] public virtual string PeriodID { ... }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Div`2
member.summary: Returns the division of Operand1 and Operand2

member.name: T:PX.Data.IsNull`2
member.summary: Returns Operand1 if it is not null, or Operand2 otherwise. Equivalent to SQL function ISNULL.
member.example:
The code below shows a part of a DAC field definition. The formula here sets the CuryRUTROTUndistributedAmt field at run time to the difference of the ARInvoice.CuryRUTROTTotalAmt and ARInvoice.CuryRUTROTTotalAmt values and to decimal zero if any of these values is null.
[PXFormula(typeof( IsNull<Sub<ARInvoice.curyRUTROTTotalAmt, ARInvoice.curyRUTROTDistributedAmt>, decimal0>))] public virtual decimal? CuryRUTROTUndistributedAmt { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Minus`1
member.summary: Returns -Operand (multiplies by -1).
member.example:
The code below shows the usage of the Minus<> class in the calculation of a DAC field through the PXDBCalced attribute.
[PXDefault(TypeCode.Decimal, "0.0")] [PXDBCalced( typeof(Switch< Case<Where<LandedCostTran.aPDocType, Equal<APDocType.debitAdj>>, Minus<LandedCostTran.curyLCAPAmount>>, LandedCostTran.curyLCAPAmount>), typeof(Decimal))] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Amount")] public virtual Decimal? CuryLCAPEffAmount { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.NullIf`2
member.summary: Returns null if Operand1 equals Operand2 and returns Operand1 if the two expression are not equal. Equivalent to SQL function NULLIF.
member.example:
The code below shows part of the definition of a DAC field. The NullIf<,> class is used in the formula to prevent deletion by zero. If the APTran.qty equals zero, the formula returns null, so the CuryDiscCost value is null.
[PXFormula(typeof( Div<Sub<APTran.curyTranAmt, APTran.curyDiscAmt>, NullIf<APTran.qty, decimal0>>))] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Disc. Unit Cost", Enabled = false, Visible = false)] public virtual Decimal? CuryDiscCost { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Replace`3
member.summary: Replaces all occurrences of a string with another string in the source expression. Equivalent to SQL function REPLACE.
member.example:
The code below shows a part of a BQL command and the corresponding SQL code (provided str_AAA and str_BBB are classes representing string constants "AAA" and "BBB").
Replace<Table1.field1, str_AAA, str_BBB>
REPLACE(Table1.Field1, "AAA", "BBB")

member.name: T:PX.Data.Round`2
member.summary: Returns a numeric value rounded to the specified precision. Equivalent to SQL function ROUND.
member.typeparam: The numeric expression, given by a field, constant, or function.
The precision, given by a field, constant, or function.
member.example:
The code below shows the definition of a DAC field that is calculated at run time by a formula.
[PXFormula(typeof( Sub<Mult<SOLine.openQty, SOLine.curyUnitPrice>, Round<Div<Mult<Mult<SOLine.openQty, SOLine.curyUnitPrice>, SOLine.discPct>, decimal100>, SOLine.curyInfoID>>))] [PXDefault(TypeCode.Decimal, "0.0")] public virtual Decimal? CuryOpenAmt { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.StrLen`1
member.summary: Returns the Length in characters of the Source string.

member.name: T:PX.Data.Sub`2
member.summary: Returns the subtraction of Operand2 from Operand1.
member.example:
The code below shows the definitinon of the CuryUnappliedBal field in the ARPayment DAC. The field is set to the difference of CuryDocBal and CuryApplAmt fields.
[PXCurrency(typeof(APPayment.curyInfoID), typeof(APPayment.unappliedBal))] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Unapplied Balance", Visibility = PXUIVisibility.Visible, Enabled = false)] [PXFormula(typeof(Sub<APPayment.curyDocBal, APPayment.curyApplAmt>))] public virtual Decimal? CuryUnappliedBal { ... }

member.name: T:PX.Data.Substring`3
member.summary: Returns the Length characters from the Source string starting from the StartIndex index (the first character has index 1). Equivalent to SQL function SUBSTRING.

member.name: T:PX.Data.Switch`2
member.summary: Evaluates conditions and returns one of multiple possible values or the default value if none of the conditions is satisfied. Equivalent to SQL CASE-ELSE expression. Pairs condition-value are specified via the Case clause.
member.typeparam: Pairs condition-value specified via the Case class.
The default value as field, constant, or function.

member.name: T:PX.Data.Switch`1
member.summary: Evaluates conditions and returns one of multiple possible values. Equivalent to SQL CASE expression without the ELSE expression. Pairs condition-value are specified via the Case class.
member.typeparam: Pairs condition-value specified via the Case class.
member.remarks: The Switch clause can be used as Operand in classes such as Where ad OrderBy.
member.example:
The code below shows the definition of a DAC field calculated at run time.
[PXFormula(typeof(Switch< Case<Where<EPActivity.priority, Equal<int0>>, EPActivity.priorityIcon.low, Case<Where<EPActivity.priority, Equal<int2>>, EPActivity.priorityIcon.high>>>))] public virtual String PriorityIcon { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXCache`1
member.summary: Represents the cache of modified data records from a paricular table and the controller for basic operations over these data records. The type parameter is set to the data access class (DAC) that represents this table.
member.typeparam: The DAC type of data records stored in the cache object.

remarks.para: The cache objects consists conceptually of two parts:

item.description: The collections of the data records that were modified and not yet saved to the database, such as Updated, Inserted, Deleted, and Dirty.
The controller that executes basic data-related operations through the use of the methods, such as Update(object), Insert(object), Delete(object), Persist(PXDBOperation), and other methods.

remarks.para: During execution of these methods, the cache raises events. The graph and attributes can subscribe to these events to implement business logic. The methods applied to a previously unchanged data record result in placing of the data record into the cache.

The system creates and destroys PXCache instances (caches) on each request. If the user or the code modifies a data record, it is placed into the cache. When request execution is completed, the system serializes the modified records from the caches to the session. At run time, the cache may also include the unchanged data records retrieved during request execution. These data records are discarded once the request is served.

On the next round trip, the modified data records are loaded from the session to the caches. The cache merges the data retrieved from the database with the modified data, and the application accesses the data as if the entire data set has been preserved from the time of previous request.
The cache maintains the modified data until the changes are discarded or saved to the database.
The cache is the issuer of all data-related events, which can be handled by the graph and attributes.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.HasAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the provided data record has any attributes attached to its fields.
member.param: The data record.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.GetAttributesReadonly(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the cache-level instances of attributes placed on the specified field in the DAC.
member.remarks: The system maintains instances of attributes on three different levels. On its instantiation, a cache object copies appropriate attributes from the global level to the cache level and stores them in an internal collection. When an attribute needs to be modified for a particular data record, the cache creates item-level copies of all attributes and stores them associated with the data record.
member.param: The name of the field whose attributes are returned. If null, the method returns attributes from all fields.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.GetAttributesReadonly(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the cache-level instances of attributes placed on the specified field in the DAC.
member.remarks: Using this method, you can prevent expanding the aggregate attributes by setting the second parameter to false. Other overloads of this method always include both the aggregate attributes and the attributes that comprise such attributes.
member.param: The data record.

The value that indicates whether the attributes embedded into an aggregate attribute are included into the list. If true, both the aggregate attribute and the attributes embedded into it are included in the list. Otherwise, only the aggregate attribute is included. An aggregate attribute is an attribute that derives from the PXAggregateAttribute class. This class allows combining multiple different attributes in a single one.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.GetAttributesReadonly(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the item-level attribute instances placed on the specified field, if such instances exist for the provided data record, or the cache-level instances, otherwise.
member.param: The data record.
The name of the field whose attributes are returned. If null, the method returns attributes from all fields.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.GetAttributes(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the item-level instances of attributes placed on the specified field. If such instances are not exist for the provided data record, the method creates them by copying all cache-level attributes and storing them in the internal collection that contains the data record specific attributes. To avoid cloning cache-level attributes, use the GetAttributesReadonly(object, string) method.
member.param: The data record.
The name of the field whose attributes are returned. If null, the method returns attributes from all fields.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.GetAttributes(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the cach-level instances of attributes placed on the specified field and all item-level instances currently stored in the cache.
member.param: The name of the field whose attributes are returned. If null, the method returns attributes from all fields.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.GetValue(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of the specified field in the given data record without raising any events.

remarks.para: To get the field of a data record of a known DAC type, you can use DAC properties. If a type of a data record is unknown (for example, when it is available as object), you can use the GetValue() methods to get a value of a field. These methods can also be used to get values of fields defined in extensions (another way is to get the extension data record through the GetExtension<>() method).
The GetValueExt() methods are used to get the value or the field state object and raise events.

member.param: The data record.
The name of the field whose value is returned.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Current
member.summary: Gets or sets the current data record. This property points to the last data record displayed in the user interface. If the user selects a data record in a grid, this property points to this data record. If the user or the application inserts, updates, or deletes a data record, the property points to this data record. Assigning this property raises the RowSelected event.
member.remarks: You can reference the Current data record and its fields in the PXSelect BQL statements by using the Current parameter.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Select(PX.Data.PXDataRecord,System.Int32@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Creates a data record from the PXDataRecord object and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status if the data record isn't found among the modified data records in the cache.

remarks.para: If isReadOnly is false then:

item.description: If the cache already contains the data record with the same keys and the NotChanged status, the method returns this data record updated to the state of PXDataRecord.
If the cache contains the same data record with the Updated or Inserted status, the method returns this data record.

remarks.para: In other cases and when isReadonly is true, the method returns the data record created from the PXDataRecord object.
If the AllowSelect property is false, the methods returns a new empty data record and the logic described above is not executed.
The method raises the RowSelecting event.

member.param: The PXDataRecord object to convert to the DAC type of the cache.
The index of the first field to read in the list of columns comprising the PXDataRecord object.
The value indicating if the data record with the same key fields should be located in the cache and updated.
The value indicating whether the data record with the same keys existed in the cache among the modified data records.

member.param: The data record whose status is requested.

The new status.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Locate(System.Object)
member.summary: Searches the cache for a data record that has the same key fields as the provided data record. If the data record is not found in the cache, the method retrieves the data record from the database and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status. The method returns the located or retrieved data record.
member.remarks: The AllowSelect property does not affect this method unlike the Locate(IDictionary) method.
member.param: The data record to locate in the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Locate(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Searches the cache for a data record that has the same key fields as in the provided dictionary. If the data record is not found in the cache, the method initializes a new data record with the provided values and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status.
member.remarks: Returns 1 if a data record is successfully located or placed into the cache, and returns 0 if placing into the cache fails or the AllowSelect property is false.
member.param: The dictionary with values to initialize the data record fields. The dictionary keys are field names.

member.param: The data record to remove from the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Update(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Updates the data record in the cache with the provided values.

remarks.para: The method initalizes a data record with the provided key fields. If the data record with such keys does not exist in the cache, the method tries to retrieve it from the database. If the data record exists in the cache or database, it gets the Updated status. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method inserts a new data record into the cache with the Inserted status.

The method raises the following events: FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowUpdating, and RowUpdated. See Updating a Data Record for the events flowchart. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method also causes the events of the Insert(object) method.
If the AllowUpdate property is false, the data record is not updated and the methods returns 0. The method returns 1 if the data record is successfully updated or inserted.

member.param: The values of the key fields of the data record to update.
The new values with which the data record fields are updated.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Update(System.Object)
member.summary: Updates the provided data record in the cache.

remarks.para: If the data record does not exist in the cache, the method tries to retrieve it from the database. If the data record exists in the cache or database, it gets the Updated status. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method inserts a new data record into the cache with the Inserted status.

The method raises the following events: FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowUpdating, and RowUpdated. See Updating a Data Record for the events flowchart. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method also causes the events of the Insert(object) method.
The AllowUpdate property does not affect the method unlike the Update(IDictionary, IDictionary) method.

member.param: The data record to update in the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Insert(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes a new data record using the provided field values and inserts the data record into the cache. Returns 1 in case of successful insertion, and 0 otherwise.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: FieldDefaulting, FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowInserting, and RowInserted. See Inserting a Data Record for the events chart.

The method does not check if the data record exists in the database. The values provided in the dictionary are not readonly and can be updated during execution of the method. The method is typically used by the system when the values are received from the user interface. If the AllowInsert property is false, the data record is not inserted and the method returns 0.
In case of successful insertion, the method marks the data record as Inserted, and it becomes accessible through the Inserted collection.

member.param: The dictionary with values to initialize the data record fields. The dictionary keys are field names.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Insert(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the provided data record into the cache. Returns the inserted data record or null if the data record wasn't inserted.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: FieldDefaulting, FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowInserting, and RowInserted. See Inserting a Data Record for the events chart.
The method does not check if the data record exists in the database. The AllowInsert property does not affect this method unlike the Insert(IDictionary) method.
In case of successful insertion, the method marks the data record as Inserted, and it becomes accessible through the Inserted collection.

member.param: The data record to insert into the cache.

member.summary: Initializes a data record of the DAC type of the cache from the provided data record of the base DAC type and inserts the new data record into the cache. Returns the inserted data record.
member.param: The data record of the base DAC type which field values are used to initialize the data record.
member.example: See the Extend<Parent>(Parent) method of the PXSelectBase<> class.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Insert
member.summary: Initializes a new data record with default values and inserts it into the cache by invoking the Insert(object) method. Returns the new data record inserted into the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.CreateInstance
member.summary: Returns a new data record of the DAC type of the cache. The method may be used to initialize a data record of the type appropriate for the PXCache instance when its DAC type is unknown.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.ClearQueryCache
member.summary: Clears the internal cache of database query results.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Delete(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes the data record with the provided key values and places it into the cache with the Deleted or InsertedDeleted status. The method assigns the InsertedDeleted status to the data record if it has the Inserted status when the method is invoked.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: FieldUpdating, FieldUpdated, RowDeleting, and RowDeleted events. See Deleting a Data Record for the events flowchart.

This method is typically used to process deletion initiated from the user interface. If the AllowDelete property is false, the data record is not marked deleted and the method returns 0. The method returns 1 if the data record is successfully marked deleted.

member.param: The values of key fields.
The values of all fields. The parameter is not used in the method.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Delete(System.Object)
member.summary: Places the data record into the cache with the Deleted or InsertedDeleted status. The method assigns the InsertedDeleted status to the data record if it has the Inserted status when the method is invoked.

remarks.para: The method raises the RowDeleting and RowDeleted events. See for the events flowchart.
The AllowDelete property does not affect this method.

member.param: The data record to delete.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Dirty
member.summary: Gets the collection of updated, inserted, and deleted data records. The collection contains data records with the Updated, Inserted, or Deleted status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Updated
member.summary: Gets the collection of updated data records that exist in the database. The collection contains data records with the Updated status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Inserted
member.summary: Gets the collection of inserted data records that does not exist in the database. The collection contains data records with the Inserted status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Cached
member.summary: Get the collection of all cached data records. The collection contains data records with any status. The developer should not rely on the presense of data records with statuses other than Updated, Inserted, and Deleted in this collection.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Deleted
member.summary: Gets the collection of deleted data records that exist in the database. The collection contains data records with the Deleted status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.IsInsertedUpdatedDeleted
member.summary: Gets the value that indicates if the cache contains modified data records to be saved to database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Persist(PX.Data.PXDBOperation)
member.summary: Saves the modifications of a particular type from the cache to the database. Returns the number of saved data records.

remarks.para: Using this method, you can update, delete, or insert all data records kept by the cache. You can also perform different operations at once by passing a combination of PXDBOperation values, such as PXDBOperation.Insert | PXDBOperation.Update.
The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.

member.param: The value that indicates the types of database operations to execute, either one of PXDBOperation.Insert, PXDBOperation.Update, and PXDBOperation.Delete values or their bitwise "or" (|) combination.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Persist(System.Object,PX.Data.PXDBOperation)
member.summary: Saves the modification of the specified type from the cache to the database for a particular data record.
member.param: The data record to save to the database.
The database operation to perform for the data record, either one of PXDBOperation.Insert, PXDBOperation.Update, and PXDBOperation.Delete values or their bitwise "or" (|) combination.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.PersistUpdated(System.Object)
member.summary: Updates the provided data record in the database. Returns true if the data record has been updated sucessfully, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.
The default behavior can be modified by the PXDBInterceptor attribute.

member.param: The data record to update in the database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.PersistInserted(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the provided data record into the database. Returns true if the data record has been inserted sucessfully, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: The method throws an exception if the data record with such keys exists in the database.
The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.
The default behavior can be modified by the PXDBInterceptor attribute.

member.param: The data record to insert into the database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.PersistDeleted(System.Object)
member.summary: Deletes the provided data record from the database by the key fields. Returns true if the data record has been deleted sucessfully, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.
The default behavior can be modified by the PXDBInterceptor attribute.

member.param: The data record to deleted from the database.

member.summary: Completes saving changes to the database by raising the RowPersisted event for all persisted data records.
member.param: The value indicating whether the database operation has been aborted or completed.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXFilterableAttribute
member.summary: Placed on the view declaration, adds the control that lets a user create filters and save them in the database. The control is added to the grid that uses the view to retrieve data.

remarks.para: The attribute is placed on the view declaration.

If you specify this view as the data member of a grid control, the grid will include a control which can be used to create filters and save them in the database. A filter is a set of conditions checked for the fields selected by the view. When a grid applies a filter it displays only the data records that satisfy the filter's conditions.

example.code: [PXFilterable] public PXSelect<APInvoice> APDocumentList;

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXFilterableAttribute.#ctor(System.Type[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the attribute. The parameters are optional and are not used in most cases (you can specify the DACs whose Current objects will be used to fill the filter parameters before showing it to the user).
member.param: The DACs for the autofilling filter parameters.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute
member.summary: Sets up a button that is used to initiate the action in the user interface.

remarks.para: This attribute should be placed on the declaration of the method that implements the action.

Through attribute's parameters, you can configure some properties of the button, such ImageUrl, ShortcutChar, and Tooltip. To configure other layout properties, use the PXUIField attribute, such as DisplayName, Visible, or Enabled. Still some other properties can be set only on an ASPX page.
A number of other attributes derive from the PXButton attributes. These attribute do not implement additional logic and only set certain properties to specific values.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PXButton attribute.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ShortcutCtrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the keyboard shortcut for the button includes the Ctrl key.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ShortcutShift
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the keyboard shortcut for the button includes the Shift key.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.SpecialType
member.summary: Gets or sets the PXSpecialButtonType value that indicates whether a button has a special type, such as Save, Cancel, or Refresh, or does not have. A button of a special type may be searched, for instance, by graph methods in special occassions (the PressSave() method searches visible buttons of Save type and selects the first of them). By default, the property is set to PXSpecialButtonType.Default.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.OnClosingPopup
member.summary: Gets or sets the special type of the button that will be triggerred on closing of an application webpage that is opened in popup mode.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ClosePopup
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the enclosing popup is closed once the button logic is executed.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.PopupVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the button is visible when the enclosing webpage is opened in popup mode.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.CommitChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether a button press posts modifications to the server.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ShortcutChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that is used as the keyboard shorcut for the button. Setting additionally the ShortcutCtrl and ShortcutShift properties adds or removes Ctrl and Shift keys to and from the shortcut.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ImageSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that identifies the image set. Forms the first part of the button image URL.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ImageKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that identifies the button image within the set specified by ImageSet. Forms the second part of the button image URL.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image displayed on the button when it is enabled.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.DisabledImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image displayed on the button when it is disabled.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.HoverImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image displayed on the enabled button on hover.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.Tooltip
member.summary: Gets or sets the string displayed as a tooltip for the button.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ConfirmationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the PXConfirmationType value that indicates in what cases the confirmation message is shown to a user on a button press. By default, the property is set to PXConfirmationType.Unspecified.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ConfirmationMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the confirmation message that can be shown to a user on a button press. The cases when the configramtion message is shown depend on ConfirmationType.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXProcessing`1
member.summary: Defines a special data view used on processing webpages, which are intended for mass processing of data records.
member.remarks: The PXProcessing<Table> type is used to define the data view in a graph bound to a processing webpage. A data view of this type includes definitions of two actions, Process and ProcessAll, which are added to the graph and are used to invoke the processing. You should set the processing method by invoking one of the SetProcessDelegate(...) methods in the constructor of the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXProcessingBase`1.ProcessItemDelegate`1
member.summary: The delegate of the method for processing a single data record. The delegate allows you to receive the same instance of the provided graph type to each invocation of the processing method during the processing operation.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXProcessingBase`1.FinallyProcessDelegate`1
member.summary: The delegate of the method that is executed after all data records are processed. In the parameter, the method receives the graph that was passed to each invocation of the data record processing method during the processing operation.
member.param: The graph instance passed to invocations of the ProcessItemDelegate<Graph>(Graph, Table) delegate.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXProcessingBase`1.SetProcessDelegate(PX.Data.PXProcessingBase{`0}.ProcessListDelegate)
member.summary: Sets the method that is invoked to process multiple data records.
member.remarks: The method receives the list of the data records to process in the parameter. Depending on the buttion the user clicked to start processing, the data records are either the data records selected by the user in the grid or all data records selected by the data view.
member.param: The delegate of the processing method.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXProcessingBase`1.SetProcessDelegate(PX.Data.PXProcessingBase{`0}.ProcessItemDelegate)
member.summary: Sets the method that is invoked to process each data record.
member.remarks: The method receives the data records to process in the parameter. Depending on the buttion the user clicked to start processing, the method is invoked for each data record selected by the user in the grid, or for each data record selected by the data view.
member.param: The delegate of the processing method.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXProcessingBase`1.SetProcessDelegate``1(PX.Data.PXProcessingBase{`0}.ProcessItemDelegate{``0})
member.summary: Sets the method that is invoked to process each data record.
member.remarks: The method should have two parameters, the graph and the data record. When the user initiates processing, the data view initializes the instance of the specified graph type and passes it to the processing method while it is invoked for each data record.
member.param: The delegate of the processing method.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXProcessingBase`1.SetProcessDelegate``1(PX.Data.PXProcessingBase{`0}.ProcessItemDelegate{``0},PX.Data.PXProcessingBase{`0}.FinallyProcessDelegate{``0})
member.summary: Sets the method that is invoked to process each data record and the method that is invoked after all data records are processed.

remarks.para: The processing method should have two parameters, the graph and the data record. When the user initiates processing, the data view initializes the instance of the specified graph type and passes it to the processing method while it is invoked for each data record.

The second method has the only parameter, the graph. This method is invoked once when all data record are processed. The parameter of the method is set to the graph that was passed to the processing method for each data record.

member.param: The delegate of the processing method.
The delegate of the method invoked when all data records are processed.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBDefaultAttribute
member.summary: Sets the default value for a DAC field. Use to assign a value from the auto-generated key field.
member.example:
Setting the default value that will be taken from the current POReceipt cache object and reassigned only on insertion of the data record to the database:
public partial class LandedCostTran : PX.Data.IBqlTable { ... [PXDBString(3, IsFixed = true)] [PXDBDefault(typeof(POReceipt.receiptType), DefaultForUpdate = false)] public virtual string POReceiptType { get; set; } ... }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDefaultAttribute.PersistingCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets the PXPersistingCheck value that defines how to check the field value before saving a data record to the database. The attribute either checks that the value is not null, checks that the value is null or a blank string (contains only whitespace characters), or doesn't check the value. If the attribute discovers that the value is in fact null or blank, it will throw the PXRowPersistingException exception. As a result, the save action will fail and the user will get an error message.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDefaultAttribute.DefaultForUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the default value is reassigned on a database update operation.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDefaultAttribute.DefaultForInsert
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the default value is reassigned on a database insert operation.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the attribute which gets the default value from the item of the provided type.
member.param: Type to get the default value from, if implements IBqlField and is nested, then defines the source field as well

member.param: Cache
Event arguments to retrive the value from the Row

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBDefaultAttribute.RowPersisted(PX.Data.PXCache,PX.Data.PXRowPersistedEventArgs)

Event arguments to check operation and get the row to process

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBDefaultAttribute.SetDefaultForUpdate``1(PX.Data.PXCache,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the DefaultForUpdate property for a particular data record.
member.param: The cache object to search for the attributes of PXDBDefault type.
The data record the method is applied to. If null, the method is applied to all data records kept in the cache object.
The new value for the property.
member.example:
The code below changes the SetDefaultForUpdate property at run time. The method sets the property for the ShipAddressID field in all data records in the cache object associated with the OrderList data view.
PXDBDefaultAttribute.SetDefaultForUpdate<SOOrderShipment.shipAddressID>( OrderList.Cache, null, false);

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBFieldAttribute
member.summary: The base class for attributes that map DAC fields to database columns.The attribute should not be used directly.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBFieldAttribute.DatabaseFieldName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the database column that is represented by the field. By default, equals the field name.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBFieldAttribute.IsKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the field is a key field. Key fields must uniquely identify a data record. The key fields defined in the DAC should not necessarily be the same as the keys in the database.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBFieldAttribute.IsImmutable
member.summary: Gets or sets the values that indicates that the field is immutable.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBFieldAttribute.BqlField
member.summary: Returns null on get. Sets the BQL field representing the field in BQL queries.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBStringAttribute
member.summary: Maps a DAC field of string type to the database field of char, varchar, nchar, or nvarchar type.

remarks.para: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to the database column with the same name.
It is possible to specify the maximum length and input validation mask for the string.
You can modify the Length and InputMask properties at run time by calling the static methods.

member.example:
The attribute below defines a bound field taking as a value strings of any 8 characters. In the user interface, the input control will show the mask that splits the value into four groups separated by dots.
[PXDBString(8, InputMask = "CC.CC.CC.CC")] public virtual string ReportID { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBStringAttribute.Length
member.summary: Gets the maximum length of the string value. If a string value exceeds the maximum length, it will be trimmed. If IsFixed is set to true and the string length is less then the maximum, it will be extended with spaces.
member.remarks: The default value is -1 (the string length is not limited). A different value can be set in the constructor.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBStringAttribute.InputMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern that indicates the allowed characters in a field value. The user interface will not allow the user to enter other characters in the input control associated with the field.

remarks.para: The default value for the key fields is '>aaaaaa'.

item.description: '>': the following chars to upper case
'<': the following chars to lower case
'&', 'C': any character or a space
'A', 'a': a letter or digit
'L', '?': a letter

member.example:
The attribute below defines a bound field taking as a value Unicode strings of 5 uppercase characters that are strictly aphabetical letters.
[PXDBString(5, IsUnicode = true, InputMask = ">LLLLL")] public virtual string CuryID { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBStringAttribute.IsUnicode
member.summary: Gets or sets an indication that the string consists of Unicode characters. This property should be set to true if the database column has a Unicode string type (nchar or nvarchar). The default value is false.
member.example:
The example below shows a complex definition of a string key field represented in the user interface by a lookup control. In this example, the RefNbr field is mapped to the nvarchar(15) column from the APRegister table.
[PXDBString(15, IsUnicode = true, IsKey = true, InputMask = "")] [PXDefault] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Reference Nbr.", Visibility = PXUIVisibility.SelectorVisible, TabOrder = 1)] [PXSelector(typeof( Search<APRegister.refNbr, Where<APRegister.docType, Equal<Optional<APRegister.docType>>>>), Filterable = true)] public virtual string RefNbr { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBStringAttribute.IsFixed
member.summary: Gets or sets an indication that the string has a fixed length. This property should be set to true if the database column has a fixed length type (char or nchar). The default value is false.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBStringAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the attribute.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBStringAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with the given maximum length of a field value.
member.param: The maximum length value assigned to the Length property.
member.example:
The attribute below maps a string field to the database column (defines a bound field) and sets a limit for the value length to 50.
[PXDBString(50)] public virtual string Fax { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBLocalStringAttribute
member.summary: Maps a string DAC field to a localized string column in the database.
member.remarks: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to database columns that have culture information specified in their names. For example, for the Description field, the English-specific column will be DescriptionenGB, the Russian-specific column DescriptionruRU, etc.

[PXDefault] [PXDBByte] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Condition")] protected virtual void FilterRow_Condition_CacheAttached(PXCache sender) { }

[PXDBInt(IsKey = true, BqlField = typeof(CuryARHistory.branchID))] [PXSelector(typeof(Branch.branchID), SubstituteKey = typeof(Branch.branchCD))] public virtual int? BranchID { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBDecimalAttribute
member.summary: Maps a DAC field of decimal? type to the database column of decimal type.

remarks.para: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to the database column with the same name.
A minimum value, maximum value, and precision can be specified. The precision can be calculated at runtime using BQL. The default precision is 2.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDecimalAttribute.MinValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value for the field.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDecimalAttribute.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value for the field.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBDecimalAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with the default precision, which equals 2.

example.code: [PXDBDecimal(MaxValue = 100, MinValue = 0)] [PXDefault(TypeCode.Decimal, "50.0")] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Group/Document Discount Limit (%)")] public virtual Decimal? DiscountLimit { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBDecimalAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with the precision calculated at runtime using a BQL query.
member.param: A BQL query based on a class derived from IBqlSearch or IBqlField. For example, the parameter can be set to typeof(Search<...>), or typeof(Table1.field).
member.example:
The code below shows declaration of a DAC field with a precision calculated at runtime. The BQL query in this example will search for the Currency data record that satisfies the specified Where condition. The field precision will be set to the DecimalPlaces value from this data record.
[PXDBDecimal(typeof( Search<Currency.decimalPlaces, Where<Currency.curyID, Equal<Current<POCreateFilter.vendorID>>>> ))] public virtual decimal? OrderTotal { get; set; }

The data record the method is applied to.
The name of the field that is be marked with the attribute.
The new precision value.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBDecimalAttribute.EnsurePrecision(PX.Data.PXCache)

member.param: The cache object to search for the attributes of PXDBDecimal type.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBDateAttribute
member.summary: Maps a DAC field of DateTime? type to the database column of datetime or smalldatetime type, depending on the UseSmallDateTime flag.

remarks.para: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to the database column with the same name.
The attribute defines a field represented by a single input control in the user interface.

member.example:
The attribute below binds the field to the database column and sets the minimum and maximum values for a field value.
[PXDBDate(MinValue = "01/01/1900")] public virtual DateTime? OrderDate { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDateAttribute.InputMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string that defines how a field value inputted by a user should be formatted. The property takes the same values as DisplayMask.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDateAttribute.DisplayMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string that defines how a field value is displayed in the input control. If the property is set to a one- character string, the corresponding standard date and time format string is used. If the property value is longer, it is treated as a custom date and time format string. A particular pattern depends on the culture set by the application.
member.example:
The attribute below binds the field to the database column and sets the input and display masks. A field value will be displayed using the long date pattern. That is, for en-US culture the 6/15/2009 1:45:30 PM value will be converted to Monday, June 15, 2009.
[PXDBDate(InputMask = "d", DisplayMask = "d")] public virtual DateTime? StartDate { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDateAttribute.MinValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value for the field.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDateAttribute.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value for the field.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDateAttribute.PreserveTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the time part of a field value is preserved. If false, the time part is removed.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDateAttribute.UseSmallDateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates the database column data type: true means smalldatetime, false means datetime. By default, true.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBDateAttribute.UseTimeZone
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the attribute should convert the time to UTC, using the local time zone. If true, the time is converted. By default, true.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBTimestampAttribute
member.summary: Maps a DAC field of byte[] type to the database column of timestamp type.

remarks.para: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to the database column with the same name.

The attribute binds the field to a timestamp column in the database. The database timestamp is a counter that is incremented for each insert or update operation performed on a table with a timestamp column. The counter tracks a relative time within a database (not an actual time that can be associated with a clock). You can use the timestamp column of a data record to easily determine whether any value in the data record has changed since the last time it was read.

example.code: [PXDBTimestamp()] public virtual byte[] tstamp { get; set; }

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBTimeAttribute
member.summary: Maps a DAC field of DateTime? type to the database column of smalldatetime type. The field value holds only time without date.

remarks.para: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to the database column with the same name.
The field values keep only time without date. On the user interface, the field is represented by a control allowing a user to enter only a time value.

member.example:
The code below binds the SunStartTime DAC field to the database column with the same name and sets the default value for the field. Notice the setting of the DisplayMask property inherited from the PXDBDate attribute.
[PXDBTime(DisplayMask = "t", UseTimeZone = false)] [PXDefault(TypeCode.DateTime, "01/01/2008 09:00:00")] public virtual DateTime? SunStartTime { ... }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBTimeAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with default parameters.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBTimeAttribute.PreserveTime
member.summary: Gets the value that indicates whether the time part of a field value is preserved. Since the constructor sets this value to true, this property always returns true.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBIdentityAttribute
member.summary: Maps an auto-incremented integer DAC field of int? type to the int database column.

remarks.para: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to the database column with the same name.
The field value is auto-incremented by the attribute.
A field of this type is typically declared a key field. To do this, set the IsKey parameter to true.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBLongIdentityAttribute
member.summary: Maps an 8-byte auto-incremented integer DAC field of int64? type to the bigint database column.

remarks.para: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to the database column with the same name. The field value is auto-incremented by the database.
A field of this type is typically declared a key field. To do this, set the IsKey parameter to true.

example.code: [PXDBLongIdentity(IsKey = true)] public virtual Int64? RecordID { ... }

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBCalcedAttribute
member.summary: Defines the SQL expression that calculates an unbound field from the fields of the same DAC whose values are taken from the database.

remarks.para: You should place the attribute on the field that is not bound to any particular database column.

The attribute will translate the provided BQL query into the SQL code and insert it into the select statement that retrieves data records of this DAC. In the BQL query, you can reference any bound field of the same DAC or an unbound field marked with PXDBScalar. You can also use BQL constants, arithmetic operations, equivalents of SQL function (such as SUBSTRING and REPLACE), and the Switch expression.
If, in contrast, you need to calculate the field on the server side at run time, use the PXFormula attribute.
Note that you should also annotate the field with an attribute that indicates an unbound field of a particular data type. Otherwise, the field may be displayed incorretly in the user interface.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDBCalcedAttribute.Persistent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the field the attribute is attached to is updated after a database commit operation.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBCalcedAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance that uses the provided BQL expression to calculate the value of the field.
member.param: The BQL query that is translated into SQL code that retrieves the value of the field. Specify any combination of BQL functions, constants, and the bound fields of the same DAC.
The data type of the field.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDBCalcedAttribute.Calculate``1(PX.Data.PXCache,System.Object)
member.summary: Calculates the field value of the data record using the formula from the attribute instance that marks the specified field.
member.param: The field to calculate.
The cache object to search for the attributes of PXDBCalced type.
The data record.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDBTimeSpanAttribute
member.summary: Maps a DAC field of int? type to the int database column. The field value represents a date as a number of minutes passed from 01/01/1900.

remarks.para: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to the database column with the same name.
The field value stores a date as a number of minutes. In the UI, the string is typically represented by a control allowing a selection from the list of time values with half-hour interval.

example.code: [PXDBTimeSpan] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Run Time")] public virtual int? RunTime { get; set; ]

remarks.para: The attribute is added to the value declaration of a DAC field. The field becomes bound to the database column with the same name.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXContextCopyingRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Objects of all classes decorated by this attribute will be copied from PXContext slots to another threads.
member.remarks: Bug 41770: When QueueUserWorkItem is called, several settings are placed in arguments and later PerformOperation method restores them on background thread. We have introduced this attribute, and inside StartOperation method, before QueueUserWorkItem call, iterating through all pxcontext slots, and if an object stored is decorated with this attribute, passing it via parameters and then restoring it on the background thread that will execute operation.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.NumberFields
member.summary: If a field is a number with a prefix like CT00000040 then searching for 0040 can be a problem. All fields that are list here will get special treatment and will be indexed both with prefix and without one - CT00000040, 00000040

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.WhereConstraint
member.summary: Constrant that when set controls whether the given instance of a DAC is searchable or not. Ex: Contact DAC is used to represent different types or records including lead which is searchable whereas accountProperty is not.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.MatchWithJoin
member.summary: When a MatchWith Type is used. Join has to be specified for the Entity containg the GroupMask column. ex. When checking the ARInvoice a join to Customer must be provided.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.SelectForFastIndexing
member.summary: When Specified this select is used for Massprocess Index rebuild. Search may include additional joined tables so that if a searchable fields can retrieved in one select and avoid the lazy-loading for each and every row through selector.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.GetSearchableFields(PX.Data.PXCache)
member.summary: Returns all searchable fields including dependent fields and key fields. Ex: Since Contact.DisplayName depends on FirstName, LastName, etc. all these fields will also be returned.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute
member.summary: Configures the lookup control for a DAC field that references a data record from a particular table by holding its key field.See

remarks.para: The attribute configures the input control for a DAC field that references a data record from a particular table. Such field holds a key value that identifies the data record in this table.

The input control will be of "lookup" type (may also be called a "selector"). A user can either input the value for the field manually or select from the list of the data records. If a value is inserted manually, the attribute checks if it is included in the list. You can specify a complex BQL query to define the set of data records that appear in the list.

The key field usually represents a database identity column that may not be user-friendly (surrogate key). It is possible to substitute its value with the value of another field from the same data record (natural key). This field should be specified in the SubstituteKey property. In this case, the table, and the DAC, have two fields that uniquely identify a data record from this table. For example, the Account table may have the numeric AccountID field and the user-friendly string AccountCD field. On a field that references Account data records in another DAC, you should place the PXSelector attribute as follows.
The attribute will automatically convert the stored numeric value to the displayed string value and back. Note that only the AccountCD property should be marked with IsKey property set to true.

It is also possible to define the list of columns to display. You can use an appropriated constructor and specify the types of the fields. By default, all fields that have the PXUIField attribute's Visibility property set to PXUIVisibility.SelectorVisible.

Along with a key, some other field can be displayed as the description of the key. This field should be specified in the DescriptionField property. The way the description is displayed in the lookup control is configured in the webpage layout through the DisplayMode property of the PXSelector control. The default display format is ValueField – DescriptionField. It can be changed to display the description only.
To achieve better performance, the attribute can be configured to cache the displayed data records.

example.para: The first example below shows the simplest PXSelector attribute declaration. All Category data records will be available for selection. Their CategoryCD field values will be inserted without conversion.
Other code samples show DAC field definitions with more complex configurations of lookup controls.
example.code: [PXSelector(typeof(Category.categoryCD))] public virtual string CategoryCD { get; set; }

[PXDBString(15, IsUnicode = true, InputMask = ">CCCCCCCCCCCCCCC")] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Order Nbr.", Enabled = false)] [PXSelector( typeof(Search<SOOrder.orderNbr, Where<SOOrder.orderType, Equal<Optional<ARAdjust.adjdOrderType>>>>), Filterable = true)] public virtual String AdjdOrderNbr { get; set; }

[PXDBString(15, IsKey = true, IsUnicode = true, InputMask = ">CCCCCCCCCCCCCCC")] [PXDefault()] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Reference Nbr.", Visibility = PXUIVisibility.SelectorVisible, TabOrder = 1)] [PXSelector( typeof(Search<ARPriceWorksheet.refNbr>), new Type[] { typeof(ARPriceWorksheet.refNbr), typeof(ARPriceWorksheet.status), typeof(ARPriceWorksheet.descr) })] public virtual String RefNbr { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.GetSelect
member.summary: Returns Bql command used for selection of referenced records.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.CacheGlobal
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the attribute should cache the data records retrieved from the database to show in the lookup control. By default, the attribute does not cache the data records.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.DescriptionField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field from the referenced table that contains the description.
member.example:
In the code below, the PXSelector attribute configures a lookup field that will let a user select from the data set defined by the Search query. The lookup control will display descriptions of the data records taken from CRLeadClass.description field.
[PXDBString(10, IsUnicode = true, InputMask = ">aaaaaaaaaa")] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Class ID")] [PXSelector( typeof(Search<CRLeadClass.cRLeadClassID, Where<CRLeadClass.isActive, Equal<True>>>), DescriptionField = typeof(CRLeadClass.description))] public virtual string ClassID { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.FilterEntity
member.summary: Gets or sets the type that is used as a key for saved filters.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.SubstituteKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the field from the referenced table that substitutes the key field used as internal value and is displayed as a value in the user interface (natural key).
member.example:
The attribute below let the user select from the Branch data records. The attribute displays the Branch.BranchCD field value in the user interface, but actually assigns the Branch.BranchID field value to the field.
[PXSelector(typeof(Branch.branchID), SubstituteKey = typeof(Branch.branchCD))] public virtual int? BranchID { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.Field
member.summary: Gets the field that identifies a referenced data record (surrogate key) and is assigned to the field annotated with the PXSelector attribute. Typically, it is the first parameter of the BQL query passed to the attribute constructor.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.DirtyRead
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the attribute should take into account the unsaved modifications when displaying data records in control. If false, the data records are taken from the database and not merged with the cache object. If true, the data records are merged with the modification stored in the cache object.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.ValidateValue

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.Filterable

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.Headers
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of labels for column headers that are displayed in the lookup control. By default, the attribute uses display names of the fields.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.ValueField

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.SelectorMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that determines the value displayed by the selector control in the UI and some aspects of attribute's behavior. You can assign a combination of PXSelectorMode values joined by bitwise or ("|").
member.example:
In the following example, the SelectorMode property is used to disable autocompletion in the selector control.
... [PXSelector( typeof(FinPeriod.finPeriodID), DescriptionField = typeof(FinPeriod.descr), SelectorMode = PXSelectorMode.NoAutocomplete)] public virtual String FinPeriodID { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance that will use the specified BQL query to retrieve the data records to select from. The list of displayed columns is created automatically and consists of all columns from the referenced table with the Visibility property of the PXUIField attribute set to PXUIVisibility.SelectorVisible.
member.param: A BQL query that defines the data set that is shown to the user along with the key field that is used as a value. Set to a field (type part of a DAC field) to select all data records from the referenced table. Set to a BQL command of Search type to specify a complex select statement.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Type[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance that will use the specified BQL query to retrieve the data records to select from, and display the provided set of columns.
member.param: A BQL query that defines the data set that is shown to the user along with the key field that is used as a value. Set to a field (type part of a DAC field) to select all data records from the referenced table. Set to a BQL command of Search type to specify a complex select statement.
Fields to display in the control.
member.example:
The attribute below configures the lookup control to let the user select from the Customer data records retrieved by the Search BQL query. The displayed columns are specified explicitly: AccountCD and CompanyName. The Customer.accountCD field data will be inserted as a value without conversion.
[PXSelector( typeof(Search<Customer.accountCD, Where<Customer.companyType, Equal<CompanyType.customer>>>), new Type[] { typeof(Customer.accountCD), typeof(Customer.companyName) })] public virtual string AccountCD { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.SelectSingleBound(PX.Data.PXView,System.Object[],System.Object[])
member.summary:
A wrapper to PXView.SelectMultiBound() method, extracts the first table in a row if a result of a join is returned.
While we are looking for a single record here, we still call SelectMulti() for performance reason, to hit cache and get the result of previously executed queries if any.
'Bound' means we will take omitted parameters from explicitly defined array of rows, not from current records set in the graph.
member.param: PXView instance to be called for a selection result
List of rows used as a source for omitted parameter values
List of parameters to be passed to the query
member.returns: Foreign record retrieved

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXNoteAttribute
member.summary: Binds a DAC field of long? type to the database column that keeps note identifiers and enables attachment of text comments, files, and activity items to a data record.

remarks.para: The attribute should be placed on the DAC field that will hold the identifier of the related note. A note is a data record in the Note database table. A note data record contains the note identifier, the text comment, the DAC name of the related data record, and some other fields.

Only one data record can reference a note. So the identifier of this note can be used as the global identifier of the data record. Thanks to this fact, in addition to adding text comments to a data record notes are used to implement:

item.description: Full-text search of data records: A note can be used to store the specified fields of the related data record, which can be found by these fields through the website search.

File attachments: The relationships between files and notes are kept in a separate table, NoteDoc, as pairs of a file identifier and note identifier. The UploadFile stores general information about files, and the UploadRevision stores specific revisions of files.
Association of activity items with a data record.

remarks.para: For any of these features to work, the given DAC should define a field marked with the PXNote attribute.

example.para: The attribute below indicates that the DAC field references a note. new Type[0] is used as parameter to force creation of the note on saving of a data record even if the used did not create a note manually.
example.code: [PXNote(new Type[0])] public virtual long? NoteID { get; set; }
example.para: In the second example, the attribute indicates that the DAC field holds note identifier, sets the lists of fields (from different tables) that will be saved in the note, and allows association of a data record with activity items. It will be possible to find the Vendor data record through the application website search by the values of these fields.
example.code: [PXNote( // The fields to save in the note typeof(Vendor.acctCD), typeof(Vendor.acctName), typeof(Contact.eMail), typeof(Contact.phone1), typeof(Contact.fax), typeof(Address.addressLine1), typeof(Address.city), typeof(Address.countryID), typeof(Address.postalCode), // Vendor fields that reference the related Contact and Address data records ForeignRelations = new Type[] { typeof(Vendor.defContactID), typeof(Vendor.defAddressID) }, ExtraSearchResultColumns = new Type[] { typeof(CR.Contact) }, // Allow attaching activity items to Vendor data records ShowInReferenceSelector = true, DescriptionField = typeof(Vendor.acctCD), Selector = typeof(Vendor.acctCD) )] public virtual long? NoteID { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXNoteAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the attribute that will be used to attach notes to data record but won't save values of the fields in a note.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXNoteAttribute.#ctor(System.Type[])

member.remarks: If you don't need to save fields in the note, but need to have a note automatically created for each data record of the current DAC type, provide an empty array as the parameter: [Note(new Type[0])]

If the property equals true, the DAC will appear in the list of types in the lookup that selects the related data record for an activity. If the property equals false, activity attributes cannot be associated with data records of the DAC. By default the property equals false.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXRefNoteAttribute
member.summary: Marks a DAC field that holds a reference to a data record of any DAC type through the note ID.

remarks.para: The field marked with the PXRefNote attribute is typically represented by the PXRefNoteSelector control on the ASPX page. Through this control, a user can select a data records from any table. A data record is referenced through its NoteID field, whose value is written to the field associated with the PXRefNoteSelector control (and marked with the PXRefNote attribute). The field should be of the Guid? data type.
In the UI, the PXRefNoteSelector control displays the selected data record's description, which is composed of the fields that are marked with the PXFieldDescription attribute.

member.example:
The code below shows the usage of the PXRefNote attribute in the defition of a DAC field.
[PXRefNote] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "References Nbr.")] public virtual Guid? RefNoteID { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXRefNoteAttribute.FullDescription
member.summary: Get, set.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDimensionAttribute
member.summary: Sets up the input control for a DAC field that holds a segmented value. The control formats the input as a segmented key value and displays the list of allowed values for each key segment when the user presses F3 on a keyboard.

example.code: [PXDimension("SUBACCOUNT", ValidComboRequired = false)] public virtual string SubID { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDimensionAttribute.ValidComboRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the user can specify only one of the predefined values as a segment or the user can input arbitrary values.

member.summary: Gets or sets the one character long string that will be treated as a wildcard – a character that matches any symbols. Typically, the property is set when the field to which the attribute is attached is used for filtering. See also the PXDimensionWildcard attribute.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDimensionSelectorAttribute
member.summary: Sets up the lookup control for a DAC field that holds a segmented key value or references a data record identified by a segmented key. The attribute combines the PXDimension and PXSelector attributes.
member.example:
The attribute below sets up the control for input of the BIZACCT segmented key's values. Since the AcctCD field itself is specified as the substitute key it will keep the segmented key value.
[PXDimensionSelector( "BIZACCT", typeof(BAccount.acctCD), // BQL query for lookup typeof(BAccount.acctCD))] // Substitute key public virtual string AcctCD { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDimensionSelectorAttribute.Filterable
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the filters defined by the user should be stored in the database.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDimensionSelectorAttribute.DirtyRead
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the attribute should take into account the unsaved modifications when displaying data records in control. If false, the data records are taken from the database and not merged with the cache object. If true, the data records are merged with the modification stored in the cache object.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDimensionSelectorAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Type)

member.param: The string identifier of the segmented key.

A BQL query that defines the data set that is shown to the user along with the key field that is used as a value. Set to a field (type part of a DAC field) to select all data records from the referenced table. Set to a BQL command of Search type to specify a complex select statement.

member.param: The string identifier of the segmented key.

A BQL query that defines the data set that is shown to the user along with the key field that is used as a value. Set to a field (type part of a DAC field) to select all data records from the referenced table. Set to a BQL command of Search type to specify a complex select statement.
The field to sustitute the surrogate field's value in the user interface.

example.code: [PXDimensionSelector( InventoryAttribute.DimensionName, typeof( Search<InventoryItem.inventoryID, Where<InventoryItem.itemType, Equal<INItemTypes.nonStockItem>, And<Match<Current<AccessInfo.userName>>>>>), typeof(InventoryItem.inventoryCD), DescriptionField = typeof(InventoryItem.descr))] public virtual int? RunRateItemID { get; set; }
